isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEMS DIAGNOSTICS - Diagnostic Procedures for Sensors and Actuators - Temperature Sensor Tests using Master Diagnostics

svcproc.title: Temperature Sensor Tests using Master Diagnostics

step1.para: Plug the Electronic Service Tool (EST) tool into the ATA connector and start Master Diagnostics.
Install correct breakout harness to engine harness only.

Monitor signal voltage with the EST using continuous monitor ssn. and initiating continuous monitor test (KOEO) (voltage should be greater than 4.6V). See Diagnostic table in Section 7 for the sensor being tested.

item.para: If voltage is less than 4.6V, check signal circuit for short to ground.
If voltage is greater than 5.5V, check signal circuit for short to B+.

step1.para: Install 3-Banana plug harness between green (signal circuit), and black (signal ground) pins of breakout harness.

item.para: If voltage is less than 0.127V, check ground circuit for open or high resistance.

step1.para: Connect engine or chassis harness to sensor.
Use the EST to clear DTCs.

item.para: If an active DTC remains after checking test conditions, replace sensor.
